page.title: 20Llanrhaedr-yng-Ngninmerch
page.content: From{Denbigh}a journey along{Ruthin Rd or one of the winding country roads through{Ystrad}and the{Glyn}brings us to where our block ends at the tip of {Llanrhaedr village.}A booklet describ- -ing a{Nature trail,}which won a prize in a County competition was written by the Women's Institute.Only part of the trail passes through our area but it was well worth investigating. {Llanrhaedr-yng-Ngninmerch}means the {holy place by the waterfall in the {Hundred of Cynmerch.}The settlement grew up around a{curative well.}The belief in the{healing properties}cont- -inued for many centuries during which {St Dyfnog's well,}a rectangular pool of dressed stone, has been a place of {pilgrimage.}Clustering around is all the vegetation which favours damp shaded spots like Dog's mercury,Ivy and Herb Robert.
